column5: You should be able to purchase bait in Geraldton or Longlac. I googled bait stores in Greenstone area and there are at least two still operating.

Hey thanks Spartan my good man, I guess I could of done that but thought maybe some were better than others meaning maybe some bad experiences some of the fisherman have had on this board. I know Ill get an honest answer here. Thanks

I did some further research. Not sure what their prices are but it there are two bait shops most commonly mentioned. Skinners in Longlac 807-876-2245 and Joel's Bait Shop in Geraldton 807-853-1436. I will be traveling to Nakina in early August and plan to reach out to these places well in advance to reserve the bait we want. Hope this helps and best of luck.
Pennocks motel in nakina can get your crawlers also,just call n order.

So, we are planning on boating up to the northwest angle from Warroad and fishing both US and Canada water. Is there any way for us to get crawlers in Canada? If we have them shipped from Canada and have the receipt would that work? Or do we just fish artificials
Iam sure there is a camp there you could get bait from.That or go to shore and dig some up.
Every camp should have a back hoe there so the clients can dig up worms.
I don't believe I've ever bought a flat of Destructive jumping worms ! Let alone seen one !..........Give me a break !!!
Won't have to jig your jig, just let the worm jump around.

[QUOTE=Eckohlt;6647672]Ok guys here's the best deal for your shopping experience.Just talked to Wayne and he said they'll have lots of worms for anybody coming through in our area.90 cdn for a flat of top notch canadian crawlers.You can order them at these places for your convinience.Dryden store-1-807-223-5210Red Lake -1-807-727-9888Cedar Lake -1-807-227-2154Hope this helps you out.
[QUOTE=prov1800;6647680]Thanks for that info john.

[QUOTE=prov1800;6647680]Thanks, John. Do you happen to know if Dutchies will be open this year? I've gotten a flat from them my previous 3 or 4 trips to LS. Thought I'd heard they changed owners again.
[QUOTE=Carnhzkr;6647696]I think so.Havnt heard any different.

[QUOTE=Carnhzkr;6647696]Howdy Keith, Your other option would be to order some crawlers through Bobby's in Vermilion Bay. It is right before the turn for 105 on your way to Lac Seul. Hope you have some great trips this year. PjShorthorn

It seems clear that we can no longer cross the border with bait of any kind. My question is, with the new BMZs are you able to cross from one to another with Crawlers? All I can find is related to baitfish. We cross at the Soo and drive up to White River which is in a different BMZ than the Soo and cannot tell if we need to buy them in Wawa or if it is ok to buy in the Soo.
[QUOTE=pjshorthorn;6647756]Much moŕe scenic up at Clarks Northern Lights and no highway noise.
If you are traveling route 631 from 11 and arrival is in Nakina, is there anywhere along the way that you can purchase night crawlers of for some reason the outfitter does not have them? Thanks, john

We are trying to determine what the rules are currently about taking night crawlers across the border. The area we fish does not have much for reliable bait shops and precovid, we took our own crawlers. One of the guys tried to call to clarify but the govt agents on the phone could not clarify what the current rules actually are. Does anyone have any current information on if crawlers are allowed to be taken into Canada?
So far it's a no from what I have seen. May want to throw some Gulp earthworms in as a precaution.
Lots of info here..... https://www.cbsa-asfc.gc.ca/services...peces-eng.htmlmore here https://inspection.canada.ca/plant-h.../1590683262739
With this new invasive species of worm being warned about in Ontario this year, I suspect the rules will stay the same or get stricter. https://torontosun.com/news/local-ne...io-this-spring
Stricter in what way??
I have no idea , how be stricter, but reaction to invasives has never been to be looser.
Your outfitter can’t arrange a flat? If not, go with plastics as the fishing is so good live bait is over rated.

No live or frozen bait allowed over border. There are some posted places on WC of where you can order them. We are getting half a flat for two of us in Canada. Not a big deal. Rather the crawlers be banned than all of us
Yeah they say artificial out fishes live bait ! Thats why i use live bait , because its more of a challenge !
There will be no live bait (dead, frozen, salted or otherwise) allowed to be brought into Canada in 2022. Just wanted it to be crystal clear. It may change in future years, but not this year.
